intro: Oplonia acicularis, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and unique floral structures. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are often clustered in cup-like structures called cyathia. Oplonia acicularis is known for its hardy nature and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
